Package no.hiof.webframework.Servlet.Default

Class LoginServlet

java.lang.Object
javax.servlet.GenericServlet
javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
no.hiof.webframework.Servlet.Default.LoginServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class LoginServlet extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
The LoginServlet class is a subclass of the AbstractServlet class,representing the login page of a web application. It allows users to log in by entering their username and password.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • doPost

      protected void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Handles POST requests sent to the login page. Validates the user's credentials by checking them against a database. If the user exists in the database, redirects them to the home page. If not, redirects them back to the login page.
      Overrides:
      doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object containing the request made to the servlet
      response - the HttpServletResponse object containing the response that will be sent back to the client
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurred while handling the request

    • getPageContent

      protected InputStream getPageContent()
      Returns the InputStream of the login page content.
      Returns:
      the InputStream of the login page content

    • doGet

      protected void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Handles HTTP GET requests by setting the content type to text/html, setting the response status to OK, and writing the page content to the response output stream.
      Overrides:
      doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object representing the client's request.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object representing the server's response.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while handling the request.
